ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.
M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

do you have concerns about your child's development?
specify concerns about your child's development
does anyone else have concerns about your child's development?
specify else's concerns about your child's development
specify anything else about your child you would like us to know
Who made your child's referral to the developmental clinic?
Why was your child referred to the developmental clinic?
Has your child ever been referred for a developmental assessment before?
Notes: 1=Yes, but he/she did not complete the assessment; 2=Yes, an assessment was completed with normal results; 3=No, this is his/her first referral for a development assessment

ElementDescription: What other appointments, if any, has your child had that are associated with the developmental assessment process? (For example, your child's pediatrician may have referred him/her to audiology, neurology, or other specialists for different types of assessments.)

Knowing that the developmental assessment involves multiple appointments, and considering things that might affect your ability to complete this process such as transportation, time off of work, and childcare, on a scale of 0-10, how hard do you think it will be to complete the developmental assessment process on your own in the next 3 months?
On a scale of 0-10, how confident are you that you will be able to complete the developmental assessment process on your own in the next 3 months?
On a scale of 0-10, how worried are you about how your child is developing?
Explain worried: Can you tell me why you answered a [insert number from previous answer]?
On a scale of 0-10, how important is it for your child to complete the developmental assessment?
Are you home with your child full-time during the work week?
If no, who watches your child during the work week?
Notes: 1=In home care from family member or babysitter; 2=Out of home care from family member or babysitter; 3=Out of home care at childcare center; 4=Other

ElementDescription: During the work week, how frequently is your child cared for by someone other than yourself?
